title: Ginger Paste Substitutes

items.name: Fresh ginger
items.details: Grate or finely chop. Use the same amount as the recipe calls for in ginger paste (1:1 ratio).

items.name: Ground ginger
items.details: Use about 1/4 of the amount of ginger paste called for (e.g., 1 tsp paste = 1/4 tsp ground ginger).

items.name: Ginger powder
items.details: Same as ground ginger: use about 1/4 tsp per teaspoon of ginger paste.

items.name: Minced or crushed ginger in a jar
items.details: A convenient swap that can be used in a 1:1 ratio.

items.name: Ginger juice
items.details: Extract juice from fresh ginger by grating and pressing. Use in the same amount as the paste.

items.name: Ginger-garlic paste
items.details: Works if the recipe also calls for garlic. Adjust other garlic quantities to balance the flavor.

notes: Conversion example: If a recipe needs 1/2 tbsp ginger paste, substitute with 1/2 tsp ground ginger.
